alert.note: Alert for Marshall; Starke (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 25 at 2:23PM EDT until June 25 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: The National Weather Service in Northern Indiana has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northeastern Starke County in northwestern Indiana... Northwestern Marshall County in north central Indiana... * Until 300 PM EDT/200 PM CDT/. * At 223 PM EDT/123 PM CDT/, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Hamlet, or near Knox, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Hamlet around 230 PM EDT. Koontz Lake around 245 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Donaldson, Brems, Teegarden, Tyner and Grovertown. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
